--- In gladiator@yahoogroups.com, "Daniel Paul Hightower 
<dph_of_rules@u...>" <dph_of_rules@u...> wrote:
> Yea, this week we are discussing mages & barbarians.
> 
> I'll add a few comments: the ability to "freeze time" isn't fun on 
the 
> receiving end.  Hypothetically, you could keep time frozen until 
you 
> wipe out the entire enemy force, as long as you have sufficient 
mana. 
>  It gets aggrevating if a friendly mage keeps freezing time when 
the 
> rest of your team is out of mana.
> 
> Heartburst is a very effective attack against 1-5 people.  If it 
> effects more people, all you are doing is causing is chaos among 
enemy 
> ranks.  Side note: Using heartburst attack against slime has caused 
> the slime to grow, making heartburst not an effective attack 
against 
> strong slime.
> 
> Barbarians really do need more attacks.


Mages
Extremely too powerful because mana can be gained so quickly and used 
in powerful moves such as freeze time and heartburst. 
But they are balanced enough, if there was a move that reduced there 
mana. 

They have enough moves as is, but there could be some potential shift-
moves. 

Barbarian
Barbarians should have a move that reduces mana from surronding 
enemies, like War Cry.
